burlap.oomdp.singleagent.pomdp.beliefstate.tabular

Class TabularBeliefState

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.oomdp.singleagent.pomdp.beliefstate.tabular.TabularBeliefState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    State, BeliefState, DenseBeliefVector, EnumerableBeliefState

    public class TabularBeliefState
extends java.lang.Object
implements BeliefState, EnumerableBeliefState, DenseBeliefVector
    A class for storing a sparse tabular representation of the belief state. That is, each MDP state is assigned a unique identifier using a StateEnumerator and this class uses a Map to associated the probability mass with each state. MDP states that have zero mass are not stored in the map.
    The OO-MDP representation of this state associates with a singleton SADomain that has one ObjectClass named belief, that has one double array attribute named belief. When An OO-MDP state representation is request, an MutableObjectInstance belonging to class belief is created with its belief attribute set to the dense (non-sparse) belief vector that this BeliefState represents.
    If using a BeliefMDP solver with a TabularBeliefState, it is recommended that you use HashableTabularBeliefStateFactory which will compute hash codes and perform state equality checks with the sparse Map representation (rather than the dense OO-MDP representation)
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

      • setBelief

        public void setBelief(State s,
             double b)
        Sets the probability mass (belief) associated with the underlying MDP state. If this object has not yet assigned a unique identifier to the provided MDP state, then it will first create one. Note that using this method will not ensure that the total probability mass across this belief state sums to 1, so other changes will have to be specified manually.
        Parameters:
        s - the underlying MDP state defined as a State
        b - the probability mass to assigned to the underlying MDP state.

      • setBelief

        public void setBelief(int stateId,
             double b)
        Sets the probability mass (belief) associated with the underlying MDP state. Note that using this method will not ensure that the total probability mass across this belief state sums to 1, so other changes will have to be specified manually.
        Parameters:
        stateId - the unique numeric identifier of the underlying MDP state defined.
        b - the probability mass to assigned to the underlying MDP state.

                       State sp)
        Returns the probability that the underlying MDP will transition from state s to sp when taking action a in state s.
        Parameters:

        ga - the taken action defined by a GroundedAction
        sp - The next MDP state observed defined by a State.
        Returns:
        the probability that the underlying MDP will transition from state s to sp when taking action a in state s.

      • initializeAllBeliefValuesTo

        public void initializeAllBeliefValuesTo(double initialValue)
        Initializes the probability mass of all underlying MDP states to the specified value. Note that this will not enforce summing to one, so you will have to manually modify the value of other states if initialValue is not 1/n where n is the number of underlying MDP states.
        Parameters:
        initialValue - the probability mass to assign to each state.

      • getObjectMatchingTo

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getObjectMatchingTo(State so,
                                                                   boolean enforceStateExactness)
        Description copied from interface: State
        This method computes a matching from objects in the receiver to value-identical objects in the parameter state so. The matching is returned as a map from the object names in the receiving state to the matched objects in state so. If enforceStateExactness is set to true, then the returned matching will be an empty map if the two states are not OO-MDP-wise identical (i.e., if there is a not a bijection between value-identical objects of the two states). If enforceExactness is false and the states are not identical, the the method will return the largest matching between objects that can be made.
        Specified by:
        getObjectMatchingTo in interface State
        Parameters:
        so - the state to whose objects the receiving state's objects should be matched
        enforceStateExactness - whether to require that states are identical to return a matching
        Returns:
        a matching from this receiving state's objects to objects in so that have identical values.
